question: Section 202 07 (d)
sols_html:
The two endpoints are \((0,1)\) and \((2,2)\). This condition can be written as:

\[\begin{aligned} p_1''(0) &= 0\\ p_2''(2) &=0\end{aligned}\]

The first derivatives:

\[\begin{aligned} p_1'(x) &= 3a_1x^2+2b_1x+c_1 \\ p_2'(x) &= 3a_2(x-1)^2+2b_2(x-1)+c_2\end{aligned}\]

and the second derivatives:

\[\begin{aligned} p_1''(x) &= 6a_1x+2b_1\Rightarrow p_1''(0)=2b_1 \\ p_2''(x) &= 6a_2(x-1)+2b_2 \Rightarrow p_2''(2)=6a_2+2b_2\end{aligned}\]

Therefore the equations are:

\[\begin{aligned} 2b_1 &= 0\\ 6a_2+2b_2 &= 0\end{aligned}\]

statement_html:
We want to interpolate through (0, 1), (1, 0), (2, 2) using cubic splines

\[\begin{aligned} f(x) = \begin{cases} p_1(x), & 0 \leq x \leq 1 \\ p_2(x), & 1 \leq x \leq 2 \end{cases}\end{aligned}\]

(d) At the endpoints we have zero second derivatives. Write down the linear equations expressing this condition.
